clinical_study.brief_title: Optimal Adalimumab Plasma Concentrations in Ankylosing Spondylitis Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Optimal Concentration Range of Adalimumab for Ankylosing Spondylitis in a Prospective Observational Study

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

collaborator.agency: Shanghai Guanghua Hospital of Integrated Traditional Chinese and Western Medicine
First Affiliated Hospital of Chongqing Medical University
The First People's Hospital of Changzhou
the first affiliated hospital of Liaoning university of traditional Chinese medicine

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

brief_summary.textblock: The optimal plasma concentration range of adalimumab in Chinese patients with active ankylosing spondylitis remains unknown, the aims of this study is to determine the concentration-effect relationship, and explore the effect of anti-drug antibody or biomarkers on clinical outcomes in a real-world setting.

detailed_description.textblock: This prospective observational study will include Chinese adult patients with active ankylosing spondylitis receiving adalimumab treatment. The primary outcome is the mean change from baseline in Ankylosing Spondylitis Disease Activity Score (ASDAS).

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in ASDAS
primary_outcome.description: ASDAS will be measured at week 24 and will be compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.description: ASAS measures symptomatic improvement in Ankylosing Spondylitis (AS) subjects. ASAS has 4 domains: patient global assessment of disease activity, pain, function, inflammation. ASAS 20 = 20% improvement (vs. baseline) and an absolute improvement ≥ 10 units on a 0-100 scale (0 = no disease activity; 100 = high disease activity) for ≥ 3 domains, and no worsening (defined as a worsening of ≥ 20% and a net worsening of ≥ 10 units) in the remaining domain.

ASAS 40 = 40% improvement (vs. baseline) and an absolute improvement ≥ 20 units on a 0-100 scale (0 = no disease activity; 100 = high disease activity) for ≥ 3 domains, and no worsening (defined as a worsening of ≥ 20% and a net worsening of ≥ 10 units) in the remaining domain.

Utilizing a Visual Analog Scale (VAS) of 0-10 (0=none and 10=very severe) subjects answered 6 questions measuring discomfort, pain, fatigue, and morning stiffness. BASDAI 50 = at least 50% improvement (vs. baseline) in BASDAI.
A decrease in ASDAS from baseline (△ASDAS) ≥ 2.0 or a moderate disease activity achievement (ASDAS < 2.1) with △ASDAS ≥ 1.1 is considered as response
ASDAS < 2.1 at assessment time point is considered as remission

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety analysis - Occurence of adverse event
secondary_outcome.description: Safety analysis include occurence of adverse event

arm_group.description: Patients with active ankylosing spondylitis receiving adalimumab treatment.

study_pop.textblock: This prospective observational study will include Chinese adult patients with active ankylosing spondylitis receiving adalimumab treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Consent of the patient.
2. Patient who meets the definition of Ankylosing Spondylitis based on the 1984 Modified New York Criteria, has a diagnosis of active Ankylosing Spondylitis (BASDAI ≥ 4, Back pain ≥ 4).
3. Patients who have indication of adalimumab.
4. Patients on NSAIDs treatment need to be on a stable dose for at least 4 weeks.
Exclusion Criteria:
(1) Hepatitis B or tuberculosis patients

overall_official.affiliation: The Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University
